Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is red and grey in section, the exterior is covered with a light-brown slip and bears very faint traces of at least three lines of Coptic text written in black ink.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393294) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393294)
